messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:04): "Fixed canvas locking in the 2dgame context to allow updating when the canvas is locked and fixed the update function to actually work" - aha, sounds like it's no longer utterly useless
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:05): http://snapshot.opera.com/unix/u950a1.html has encoding errors in [micro]Torrent's name near the bottom :-(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:18): Hmm, Canvex is broken in O9.5 - if I select "large" then it only draws the top-left quarter of the canvas
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:22): encoding error is being fixed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:23): hmm. validator.nu sucks in Opera Mini 4 beta
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:24): I wonder if I should make a handheld style sheet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:25): It seems that teaching the world that "Selectors" is not "CSS3 Selectors" is near impossible
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:25): http://canvex.lazyilluminati.com/tests/tests/results.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:27): Cool, looks like quite a lot of bugfixes and a few regressions
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:27): will Opera Mini take the handheld CSS if I bother making a separate style sheet?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (16:28): Hmm... canvex seems to mess up info panel too
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:28): I think it will, though given that pages abuse handheld CSS as well it might not...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (16:29): nm, I missed the commenting out of all those scripts
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:30): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: is there a media value that says: "I have Opera for Mobile, Opera Mini and S60 Browser for testing, I know what I'm doing."
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:31): http://canvex.lazyilluminati.com/misc/physics.html still seems peculiarly slow in Opera :-(
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:32): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I'd use a media query

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:32): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, see also http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/evolving-the-internet-on-your-phone-des-1/ which does say you can use "handheld" but media queries probably work better with other mobile devices such as the iPhone etc.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:32): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:33): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: testing validator.nu with iPhone probably ain't gonna happen (by me) as long as it isn't available in Europe
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:35): now has a mobile arsenal of 5 browsers
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:37): S60 browser, Opera for Mobile, Opera Mini 4 beta, Maemo Browser with Gecko and Maemo Browser with Opera
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (16:50): Nokia is so open-minded in their choice of browser engines
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (16:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I'd stay away from handheld, and just use media queries too
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (16:55): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: resizeTo() has, afair, to be turned on here: opera:config#UserPrefs|Allowscripttoresizewindow
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:57): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i think you could make it work ok in opera mini 4 without media queries
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:57): i.e. media="all"
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (16:57): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: with the added snag that maximized windows are unresizable
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (16:58): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: in the end it was easier to just resize manually
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (16:59): (wanted to see how Opera 9.5 did on page load speed benchmarks, which requires a consistent sized content area to be meaningful)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:59): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: use % for left and right padding on body and fieldset
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:12): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: thanks. I made it suck less
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:13): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: I think I'm still going to read about media queries one day and move the labels above the fields on narrow displays
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: ok. that should be doable (again without mq ;) ) with float and min-width
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:16): but perhaps simpler with mq
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:17): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: at least if I use mq I don't need to change markup or retest in IE :-)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:18): @media all and (max-width:15em) { ... }
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:20): table, tbody, tr, th, td { display:block; }
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:30): hmm. why does the Opera Mini doc talk about device widths instead of the rendering surface width?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:32): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/evolving-the-internet-on-your-phone-des-1/
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:32): should I expect queries relative to the rendering surface to be supported?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:34): dunno why one would want to use max-device-width at all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:35): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: max-width (as opposed to max-device-width)
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (17:35): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I think so, but I'm not entirely sure
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:35): I'm trying out Opera's IRC client.  Does anyone know if there's a way to make it automatically connect as soon as I launch Opera?
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (17:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: save the windows in a session and restore that session on startup
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:36): or just let opera remember which tabs were open last time, wfm
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (17:37): and remember to lock your IRC tabs if you want to prevent yourself from accidentally leaving a channel
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (17:37): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: File->Sessions->Save session
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (17:38): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: and close all other windows before saving the session
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:39): ok, I'll see if that worked
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:41): ok, that worked. now I need find out how to make it send my freenode password whenever I log into #whatwg
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:41): tools, mail and chat accounts
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:43): cool, it all works :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:43): hmm. Opera on desktop does weird things with max-width media queries :-(
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:44): hmm. I wonder why Opera had the default encoding set to ISO-8859-15?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:45): yes, in the IRC acct settings
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:45): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: it seems to set the max-width property of body or html. dunno which :-(
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:46): just checking it's using UTF-8 now, this should be a smily face: ‚ò?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:47): cool, that showed in the logs correctly :-)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:48): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: do you have a test case?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:50): i don't see it with 9.23
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:50): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: which do you think should be default: utf-8 or iso-8859-1?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:51): for IRC, it should be UTF-8
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:51): that's what chatzilla and xchat use, I believe
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:56): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: hmm. when I try to minimize the test case, I see neither the problem nor correct behavior...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:57): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: test case http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/test/max-width-mq.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:58): hmm. might have been a mistake in my testing or I don't grok the SSR mode in the desktop build
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:58): anyway, it turns out that max-width works
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:58): but not after window resize without reload
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:58): so the query applies at initial load time only
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:59): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: you will need to make the window narrower for the mq to apply, not just enable ssr
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:59): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: in 9.5 it gets applied as you change the window size
